{"step_by_step_thinking": "Pseudoepitheliomatous hyperplasia is a reactive epithelial proliferation that closely simulates squamous cell carcinoma. It can be present in various conditions characterized by prolonged inflammation, chronic infection, and neoplasia. Among the given choices, squamous cell carcinoma (A) is the most likely to show pseudoepitheliomatous hyperplasia.", "answer_choice": "A"}
